summary: Premium Amazon Growth Consultant landing page for Mayur Sahu / ProSellers targeting USA & UK brands. Major V4 upgrade in progress with all sections built. Latest changes being built: (1) replace About section headshot with newly uploaded Mayur Sahu photo (navy blazer, white shirt), (2) add gold crown emoji ðŸ‘‘ before ProSellers brand name in Navigation bar, (3) increase all footer content font sizes for better readability.
architectural_notes: Dark blue/black theme with gold or white text, minimal layout with lots of whitespace
Premium consultant aesthetic â€” avoid crowded layout, cheap icons, or too many colors
Calendly integration to be added later to the Strategy Call section
Recharts library used for animated Before/After charts in Case Studies section
Scroll-triggered animations implemented via Intersection Observer or similar for fade/slide-in effects
Company/brand name is 'ProSellers' â€” use in navigation logo, footer, and all branded references
Calendly placeholder URL: https://calendly.com/your-link â€” used across all Schedule Call / Request a Call Back CTAs
Floating contact strip repositioned from right-hand side vertical strip to bottom-center horizontal bar (single line: phone | email | Request a Call Back)
LeadMagnetSection merged into StrategyCallSection as 3rd box in a 3-column row; no longer a standalone section in the page flow
imageRequirements:
## Edit Images
- Crop and reframe to a professional portrait headshot with subject centered, navy blue blazer and white shirt clearly visible, framed artwork wall background, optimized for a 400x500px display slot (PixVerse_Image_Effect_prompt_this is my noraml.jpg > mayur-sahu-headshot-new.dim_400x500.png)

existing_features.title: Build a single-page React frontend with 7 sections in this order: Hero, Positioning, Services, Pricing, About, Strategy Call CTA, and Why Choose. Use a sticky top navigation bar with the consultant name/logo and a 'Book Call' CTA link that scrolls to the Strategy Call section. All sections must be full-width with generous vertical padding and a consistent dark blue/near-black background (#0A0F1E or similar).

Implement the Hero section (Section 1) with: a large bold headline 'Premium Amazon Growth Consultant for USA & UK Brands', a subheadline 'Helping serious Amazon sellers scale profitably with data-driven strategy, advanced PPC optimization and brand-focused growth.', a gold-styled CTA button labeled 'Book Free Strategy Call' that scrolls to the Strategy Call section, and small muted text below the button reading 'Limited Clients Accepted Each Month'. Center-align all content with a subtle background gradient or texture to add depth.

Implement the Positioning section (Section 2) with headline 'This Is For Serious Sellers Only', followed by text 'We work with a limited number of Amazon sellers who are ready to scale and optimize profit.', then four bullet points: 'Doing $5kâ€“$100k/month', 'Private label brands', 'USA & UK sellers', 'Ready to scale seriously'. Use gold accent bullet icons or checkmarks. Layout should feel exclusive and premium â€” not a generic feature list.

Implement the Services section (Section 3) with exactly three service groups displayed as cards or clean columns. Group 1 â€” 'Amazon Growth & Profit Optimization': Full account growth strategy, PPC scaling & ACOS reduction, Conversion optimization, Listing performance improvement. Group 2 â€” 'Brand Scaling': Product launch strategy, Brand positioning, A+ content direction, Storefront optimization. Group 3 â€” 'Advanced Support': Account suspension guidance, FBA planning, eBay expansion. Do NOT add extra services or icons beyond subtle gold accent lines/dividers.

Implement the Pricing section (Section 4) with a single centered pricing card titled 'Consulting Retainer', price display 'Starting from $500/month', supporting text 'Final pricing depends on account size and goals. Minimum 3-month commitment. We work with limited brands to maintain high performance.', and a gold CTA button labeled 'Request Consultation' that scrolls to the Strategy Call section. The card should feel premium â€” use gold border, ample padding, and white/gold typography.

Implement the About section (Section 5) with a two-column layout: left column shows the generated professional headshot image (mayur-sahu-headshot.dim_400x500.png from frontend/public/assets/generated/), right column shows name 'Mayur Sahu', title 'Amazon & Ecommerce Growth Consultant', and five credential lines: '12+ years ecommerce experience', 'Working with international sellers', 'Specialized in Amazon USA & UK', 'Data-driven scaling strategies', 'Direct expert support. No outsourcing.' On mobile, stack image above text.

Implement the Strategy Call section (Section 6) â€” the most visually prominent section â€” with headline 'Book Your Free Amazon Growth Strategy Call', supporting text 'Get account audit, growth roadmap and profit improvement insights.', and a large gold CTA button labeled 'Schedule Call Now'. Include a Calendly placeholder: render a bordered placeholder box with text 'Calendly scheduling widget will appear here' styled to match the dark theme. This section should use a slightly lighter dark background or a gold accent border to draw attention.

Implement the Why Choose section (Section 7) with five trust/differentiator bullet points: 'Work directly with expert', 'Lower cost than US agencies', 'Limited clients = full focus', 'Confidential & secure', 'Long-term growth partner'. Display as a clean horizontal row of cards or a centered vertical list with gold checkmark icons. Section should feel like a trust-builder close to the page footer.
Add a minimal footer with the name 'Mayur Sahu â€” Amazon Growth Consultant' and copyright notice. Keep it dark and understated â€” one line of small white/muted text centered.

Apply a consistent premium design system across the entire page: primary background #0A0F1E (near-black dark blue), gold accent color #C9A84C for buttons, borders, and bullet icons, white (#FFFFFF) for primary text, light gray (#A0A8B8) for subtext. Use a professional serif or elegant sans-serif Google Font for headings (e.g., Playfair Display or Cormorant Garamond) and a clean sans-serif for body text. Ensure generous whitespace, no crowded layouts, and no decorative clip-art icons.

Update the Hero section with the new headline 'We Help USA & UK Amazon Sellers Scale Profitably Without Hiring Expensive Agencies.', dual CTA buttons ('Book Free Strategy Call' and 'Get Free Account Audit' â€” both scrolling to the Strategy Call section), and three animated trust badge counters below the buttons: 'Limited Client Slots', '12+ Years Experience', 'Serving Global Sellers'. Add a subtle particle/floating-dot animated background and a parallax scroll effect on the hero background layer. Apply a gold shimmer/pulse animation on both CTA buttons.

Add a new Problem Section immediately after the Hero section with the headline 'Struggling With These?' and six pain-point items displayed as a responsive grid of cards: 'High ACOS?', 'Account Suspension?', 'No Ranking?', 'Poor Conversion?', 'FBA Issues?', 'Sales Stuck?'. Each card should use a gold accent icon (Lucide React), glassmorphism card styling with a gold glow border, and a scroll-triggered fade-in animation. The section background should be the standard #0A0F1E dark navy.

Replace the existing ServicesSection with an expanded version containing four service category cards: (1) 'Amazon Growth & Management' â€” Full account management, PPC management, Listing optimization, FBA setup; (2) 'Brand Development' â€” Brand registry, A+ content strategy, Storefront design, Product launch strategy; (3) 'Emergency Services' â€” Account reinstatement, ASIN suppression fix, Listing hijacking support; (4) 'eBay Management' â€” Account setup, Listing optimization, PPC management. Each card should use a gold-accented numbered header, gold Lucide icon, and glassmorphism card styling. Apply staggered scroll-triggered slide-up entrance animations.

Replace the existing PricingSection with a 3-tier pricing layout displaying three cards: 'Starter' ($499/month), 'Growth' ($999/month, marked as 'Most Popular' with a prominent gold badge), and 'Elite' ($1,999/month). Below the cards add the text 'Custom plans available for 7-figure brands.' and two scarcity lines: 'Minimum 3-month commitment' and 'Limited onboarding slots available'. The 'Growth' card should be visually elevated (larger, gold border glow). All cards use glassmorphism styling. Each card includes a gold CTA button that scrolls to the Strategy Call section.

Add a new Case Studies section after the Pricing section. Display three sample case study cards with Before â†’ After data using animated Recharts bar charts. Sample data: (1) Client A â€” ACOS reduced from 45% to 18%, Revenue grew from $12k/mo to $38k/mo; (2) Client B â€” Conversion rate improved from 8% to 19%, Revenue grew from $8k/mo to $24k/mo; (3) Client C â€” PPC spend reduced 35%, Revenue grew from $20k/mo to $61k/mo. Include animated number counter reveals (count-up on scroll) for the key metrics. Use the dark gold theme with glassmorphism cards.

Add a new Testimonials section after the Case Studies section. Display five sample testimonials as a responsive card grid. Each testimonial includes a client name, country flag emoji (USA ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ or UK ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§), a short review quote (2â€“3 sentences about Amazon growth results), a 5-star gold star rating, and a subtle gold border card. Use scroll-triggered staggered card entrance animations. Sample testimonial names and content should sound realistic (e.g., 'James R. ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ â€” Mayur helped us cut ACOS from 52% to 21% in just 60 days...').

Update the existing About/Founder section to use the 'Meet The Founder' heading, display Mayur Sahu's name and title 'Amazon & Ecommerce Growth Consultant', and include the following credential lines with gold checkmark icons: '12+ years ecommerce experience', 'India + international market exposure', 'Amazon USA & UK specialist', 'Data-driven scaling strategy approach', 'Direct expert support â€” no outsourcing'. Retain the existing headshot image (mayur-sahu-headshot.dim_400x500.png) in the left column with gold corner accents. Add a scroll-triggered slide-in animation for both columns.

Update the existing Why Choose section with updated differentiator content: 'Work directly with the expert (no junior managers)', 'Lower cost than US agencies â€” save up to 60%', 'Limited client slots = 100% focused attention', 'Performance-driven approach with data transparency', 'Long-term growth partner'. Display as a horizontal row of glassmorphism cards with gold Lucide icons. Add scroll-triggered staggered card entrance animations.

Update the existing Strategy Call section to include: the headline 'Book Your Free 30-Minute Amazon Growth Strategy Call', supporting text 'Get a full account audit, growth roadmap, and profit improvement insights â€” at zero cost.', a large gold 'Schedule Call Now' button (scroll-to-Calendly), a WhatsApp CTA button (green styling, Lucide MessageCircle icon, label 'Chat on WhatsApp', href 'https://wa.me/' as placeholder), and a simple email contact form with fields: Name, Email, Amazon Store URL, and a 'Send Message' submit button. Retain the Calendly placeholder box. The section should use a slightly lighter background (#0D1526) or a gold accent top border to visually stand out.

Update the Navigation bar to include links to all new sections: Home, About, Services, Pricing, Case Studies, Testimonials, Book Call. Ensure all nav links smooth-scroll to the correct section IDs. Update the mobile hamburger menu to include the new section links. Keep the sticky dark styling and 'Book Call' gold CTA button.

Apply global premium animation and visual polish across the entire page: (1) Implement scroll-triggered fade-in and slide-up animations for all sections using IntersectionObserver or a CSS animation approach; (2) Add staggered entrance animations for cards and bullet lists; (3) Apply a gold shimmer/pulse keyframe animation on all primary gold CTA buttons; (4) Add subtle hover micro-animations on all cards (scale up slightly, increase gold glow intensity); (5) Add an animated visual pathway or step-connector element between the Problem â†’ Services â†’ Pricing â†’ Strategy Call sections to visually guide users down the page; (6) All glassmorphism cards should use backdrop-blur with a semi-transparent dark background and a subtle gold border.

Replace all instances of the consultant brand name with 'ProSellers' across the entire landing page. Update the Navigation bar logo/brand text to 'ProSellers', update the Footer to read 'ProSellers â€” Amazon Growth Consultant', update the HTML page title in index.html to 'ProSellers | Amazon Growth Consultant', and update any other location where the brand/company name appears as a standalone label (e.g., section headings, meta tags, or branded taglines). The consultant's personal name 'Mayur Sahu' should remain unchanged wherever it appears as a person's name (About section, credentials, testimonial references).

Update the Footer component to add three new lines below the existing brand line: (1) 'Serving clients globally â€” USA ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ | UK ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§ | Canada ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦ | Australia ðŸ‡¦ðŸ‡º', (2) 'Operating globally across US & UK time zones', (3) 'India-based Amazon Growth Consultant working with USA & UK brands globally.' Style all three lines in light gray/muted text, smaller than the brand name but clearly readable.

Add two floating animated scroll arrow buttons to the page: one anchored to the bottom-right corner pointing upward (scroll to top) and one anchored to the bottom-right corner (slightly above the up arrow) pointing downward (scroll to bottom). Both arrows should be gold-styled circular buttons with a gentle bounce animation. Clicking the up arrow scrolls to the top of the page; clicking the down arrow scrolls to the bottom. Both buttons should appear only after the user has scrolled past the hero section.
Update the WhatsApp CTA button href in the StrategyCallSection (and any other location on the page where the WhatsApp link appears) from 'https://wa.me/' to 'https://wa.me/918766936874'.

Audit the entire page for very small text (font sizes below 14px) and small icons (below 18px) and increase them slightly to improve readability. Also increase the ProSellers logo/brand text size in the Navigation bar by approximately 20â€“25% compared to current size.

Create a floating vertical sticky side strip component that appears on the right side of the screen after the user scrolls past the hero section. The strip should contain three contact items stacked vertically: (1) Phone number display, (2) Email address, (3) 'Request a Call Back' text link pointing to 'https://calendly.com/your-link'. Style the strip with a dark semi-transparent glassmorphism background, a gold left border accent, and subtle hover effects. On mobile, hide the strip or collapse it to a minimal icon. Add this strip to App.tsx.

Create a new 'HowWeWorkSection' component and add it to App.tsx after the ServicesSection. The section heading should be 'Our 4-Step Growth Framework'. Display four steps as an animated horizontal timeline or vertical step flow: (1) 'Deep Account Audit', (2) 'Profit Gap Analysis', (3) 'Strategic Scaling Plan', (4) 'Ongoing Optimization & Monitoring'. Each step should have a gold-accented step number, a short description, a Lucide icon, and a connecting animated line or arrow between steps. Apply scroll-triggered entrance animations with stagger.

Create a new 'TrustSecuritySection' component and add it to App.tsx after the HowWeWorkSection. Section heading: 'Trust & Security'. Display four trust points as glassmorphism cards with gold Lucide icons: (1) 'Confidential handling of account data', (2) 'NDA available upon request', (3) 'Secure payment methods â€” PayPal / Wise', (4) 'Direct expert communication'. Apply scroll-triggered staggered card entrance animations.

Create a new 'GlobalServiceSection' component and add it to App.tsx after the TrustSecuritySection. Section heading: 'Serving Amazon Sellers Globally'. Display four country cards or tiles, each showing a large flag emoji and country name: ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ United States, ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§ United Kingdom, ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦ Canada, ðŸ‡¦ðŸ‡º Australia. Use glassmorphism card styling with gold border accents. Apply scroll-triggered entrance animations.

Create a new 'FAQSection' component and add it to App.tsx after the GlobalServiceSection. Section heading: 'Frequently Asked Questions'. Implement an accordion-style FAQ with all 18 Q&A pairs provided by the user. Use smooth animated expand/collapse transitions for each item. Each row should show a gold '+' / 'Ã—' toggle icon that rotates on open. Add subtle scroll-triggered fade-in for the section. Use a space-saving single-column accordion layout. Style consistently with the dark gold design system. The 18 questions and full answer texts are: (1) How do you approach Amazon account growth strategically rather than tactically? (2) How do you handle high ACOS or low profitability accounts? (3) What level of access do you require to manage an account effectively? (4) How do you ensure account safety and policy compliance? (5) Do you work with venture-backed or high-revenue brands? (6) How do you measure success for your clients? (7) What makes your consulting model different from large agencies? (8) Can you work alongside our in-house team? (9) How do you approach new product launches? (10) How do you manage communication across time zones? (11) What level of involvement is required from the client? (12) Do you take equity or performance-based compensation? (13) How do you handle multiple marketplaces (USA, UK, Canada)? (14) What happens during the first 30 days of engagement? (15) How do you maintain confidentiality and data security? (16) Do you work with aggregators or multi-brand portfolios? (17) Can you assist in preparing an account for sale or investment? (18) How selective is your client onboarding process? Full answer text for each question must be included verbatim from the user's message.

Create a new 'ComparisonSection' component and add it to App.tsx after the FAQSection. Section heading: 'Why Not US Agencies?'. Display a two-column comparison table or card layout: Left column â€” 'US Agency': '$1,500â€“$3,000/month', junior account managers, high volume, indirect communication. Right column â€” 'ProSellers Global' (highlighted in gold): 'From $500/month', direct expert access, limited clients, personalized strategy. Below the comparison, add the tagline: 'Same performance focus. Direct expert support.' The ProSellers column should be visually elevated with a gold border and glow. Apply scroll-triggered entrance animation.

Create a new 'LeadMagnetSection' component and add it to App.tsx after the ComparisonSection. Section heading: 'Free Download: 7 Profit Killers in Amazon PPC'. Display a short description: 'Discover the 7 most common mistakes that drain Amazon PPC budgets â€” and how to fix them. Download your free guide now.' Include an email input field and a gold CTA button labeled 'Get Free PDF'. The form should be static/UI-only with no backend â€” on submit, show a simple success message like 'Thank you! Check your email for the download link.' Style with glassmorphism card, gold border, consistent with the design system. Apply scroll-triggered fade-in animation.

Update all Calendly placeholder links across the entire site to use 'https://calendly.com/your-link'. This includes: the Schedule Call Now button in StrategyCallSection, the 'Request a Call Back' link in the new floating vertical side strip, the Book Call CTA in Navigation, and any other CTA buttons that reference booking or scheduling a call. Also ensure the Calendly placeholder box in StrategyCallSection is still visible and styled correctly.

Update the Navigation bar to add links for all newly added sections: 'How We Work', 'FAQ', and 'Global' (or equivalent section ID labels). Ensure smooth-scroll anchors are set correctly for all new section IDs. Update the mobile hamburger menu to include these new links.

Update the FloatingSideStrip component to reposition it from a fixed right-side vertical strip to a fixed bottom-center horizontal bar. The three contact items â€” phone number, email address, and 'Request a Call Back' link (href: 'https://calendly.com/your-link') â€” should all display on a single horizontal line within a compact bar pinned to the bottom center of the screen. The bar should retain the dark semi-transparent glassmorphism background and gold accent border (now as a top border instead of a left border). Keep the same scroll-triggered visibility (appears after scrolling past the hero section). On mobile, the bar should remain visible but may condense to icons only or a minimal single-line layout. Update App.tsx if any layout padding adjustments are needed to prevent the bar from overlapping page content.

Update the FAQSection component to display the 18 accordion items in a 2-column grid layout, so that 2 questions appear side by side in each row (resulting in 9 rows for 18 FAQs). On mobile, the layout must collapse to a single-column stack. Each accordion item should retain its existing expand/collapse animation and gold toggle icon behavior.

Create a new 'FlagStripSection' component and insert it in App.tsx immediately after the HeroSection (before the ProblemSection). The strip must display flags for all 14 major Amazon marketplace countries in a single continuous horizontal row: ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ USA, ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§ UK, ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦ Canada, ðŸ‡¦ðŸ‡º Australia, ðŸ‡©ðŸ‡ª Germany, ðŸ‡¯ðŸ‡µ Japan, ðŸ‡«ðŸ‡· France, ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡¹ Italy, ðŸ‡ªðŸ‡¸ Spain, ðŸ‡¦ðŸ‡ª UAE, ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡³ India, ðŸ‡²ðŸ‡½ Mexico, ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡· Brazil, ðŸ‡¸ðŸ‡¬ Singapore. Implement an infinite horizontal scroll/slide animation using CSS keyframes so the flag row scrolls continuously left in a seamless loop (duplicate the flag list so the loop is gapless). Each flag item must show a large emoji flag and the country name in small muted gold/silver text below it. Apply a CSS flutter/wave animation (e.g., a gentle vertical sine-wave oscillation using a CSS translate-Y keyframe) to each individual flag emoji with staggered animation-delay values so flags appear to flutter at different phases. The strip background should be a slightly lighter dark tone (e.g., #0D1526) or use a very subtle gold top and bottom border to visually separate it from the hero. The strip should be full-width with no horizontal overflow scroll bar visible (use overflow: hidden on the container). The component should be purely CSS/React with no external libraries.

Reduce vertical padding and margins between all page sections across the entire landing page for a tighter, more compact flow. Target section padding to be noticeably smaller than the current generous spacing, while still maintaining visual separation. This applies to all sections including Hero, FlagStrip, Problem, Services, HowWeWork, TrustSecurity, Pricing, CaseStudies, Testimonials, About, WhyChoose, GlobalService, FAQ, Comparison, LeadMagnet, and StrategyCall.

In HeroSection.tsx, increase the number of animated floating-dot particles on the canvas background and increase their movement speed. The particle density should be noticeably higher than the current implementation, and each particle should move faster, creating a more dynamic and energetic animated backdrop behind the hero content.

In FlagStripSection.tsx, fix the country name labels that are rendering as small squares (tofu/missing characters) for short country names. Replace any approach that relies on abbreviated text or non-rendering characters with explicit spelled-out country name strings rendered as plain HTML text. Ensure all 14 country names display correctly: USA, UK, Canada, Australia, Germany, Japan, France, Italy, Spain, UAE, India, Mexico, Brazil, Singapore â€” with no squares or missing characters on any browser.

In ServicesSection.tsx, increase the font size of the title/heading text on all four service category cards ('Amazon Growth & Management', 'Brand Development', 'Emergency Services', 'eBay Management'). The titles should be noticeably larger and more prominent, improving hierarchy and readability within each card.

Update FAQSection.tsx to display the 18 accordion items in a 3-column grid layout, so that 3 questions appear side by side in each row (resulting in 6 rows for 18 FAQs). On tablet (medium breakpoint), the layout should collapse to 2 columns. On mobile, the layout must collapse to a single-column stack. Each accordion item must retain its existing expand/collapse animation and gold toggle icon behavior.

Create a reusable 'SectionConnector' component that renders a centered blinking/pulsing gold dot element to be placed at the visual boundary between every two adjacent page sections. The dot should use a gold color (#C9A84C) with a CSS keyframe pulse/ping animation (similar to a radar ping: an inner solid dot plus an expanding outer ring that fades out). The connector should be positioned so it sits exactly at the join line between sections â€” vertically centered at the boundary â€” using a negative margin or absolute positioning so it overlaps the section boundary without adding extra vertical space. The component should be purely decorative, full-width, and zero-height in layout terms (e.g., using `position: relative` with `overflow: visible` or a zero-height wrapper with `overflow: visible`). Insert a SectionConnector instance in App.tsx between every adjacent pair of sections: after HeroSection, FlagStripSection, ProblemSection, ServicesSection, HowWeWorkSection, TrustSecuritySection, PricingSection, CaseStudiesSection, TestimonialsSection, AboutSection, WhyChooseSection, GlobalServiceSection, FAQSection, ComparisonSection, LeadMagnetSection (i.e., between every consecutive pair of sections, before StrategyCallSection). The animation should include: a solid inner circle (8â€“10px diameter), a pulsing outer ring that expands from the center and fades to transparent on each pulse cycle (animation duration ~2s, infinite loop), and an optional subtle gold glow (box-shadow). The connector should be visible against both dark section backgrounds.

In FlagStripSection.tsx, fix the country name labels that render as small squares (tofu/missing characters) on desktop and laptop browsers. Ensure each of the 14 country names is defined as a fully explicit, hard-coded plain string in the component's data array â€” 'USA', 'UK', 'Canada', 'Australia', 'Germany', 'Japan', 'France', 'Italy', 'Spain', 'UAE', 'India', 'Mexico', 'Brazil', 'Singapore' â€” with no reliance on Unicode abbreviations, character codes, or any method that may fail to render on desktop browsers. Render each name as a standard JSX text node (e.g., inside a or

). The fix must ensure all 14 names display correctly on all major desktop and laptop browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge) as well as on mobile, with zero square/tofu characters.

Rewrite FlagStripSection.tsx so that the infinite horizontal scroll/slide animation works correctly and seamlessly. The component must: (1) define the 14 country names as fully explicit, hard-coded plain string literals in the data array â€” 'USA', 'UK', 'Canada', 'Australia', 'Germany', 'Japan', 'France', 'Italy', 'Spain', 'UAE', 'India', 'Mexico', 'Brazil', 'Singapore' â€” with no Unicode abbreviations, character codes, or shorthand that could fail to render; (2) render each country name as a standard JSX text node inside a or

element so all 14 names display correctly on Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge on desktop, laptop, and mobile with zero square/tofu characters; (3) implement the infinite scroll by duplicating the flag list in the DOM and using a CSS @keyframes translateX animation so the loop is completely gapless with no visible jump; (4) apply the CSS flutter/wave oscillation (translateY sine-wave keyframe) to each individual flag emoji with staggered animation-delay values; (5) use overflow: hidden on the outer container so no horizontal scrollbar is ever visible.

Completely rewrite FlagStripSection.tsx from scratch using a fundamentally different implementation approach to fix all rendering issues: (1) Define the 14 country objects as a JavaScript array where each object has an 'emoji' string (the flag emoji character) and a 'name' string that is a fully explicit, hard-coded plain string literal â€” 'USA', 'UK', 'Canada', 'Australia', 'Germany', 'Japan', 'France', 'Italy', 'Spain', 'UAE', 'India', 'Mexico', 'Brazil', 'Singapore' â€” with zero reliance on Unicode abbreviations, character codes, or shorthand. (2) Render each flag emoji inside a dedicated <span> element with an explicit inline style setting font-family to 'Apple Color Emoji, Segoe UI Emoji, Noto Color Emoji, Android Emoji, EmojiSymbols, sans-serif' to force proper emoji font fallback on all browsers. Render each country name as a separate plain <span> JSX text node with the string value typed directly â€” no template literals, no computed values, no character codes. (3) Implement the infinite horizontal scroll by rendering the flag list twice in the DOM (original + duplicate) inside a single flex row container, and animate that container with a CSS @keyframes translateX animation that moves exactly -50% (the width of one full list copy) so the loop is completely gapless with no visible jump. (4) Apply a CSS @keyframes translateY flutter/wave oscillation to each individual flag emoji <span> with staggered animation-delay values (e.g., 0s, 0.15s, 0.3s, etc. cycling through 14 values) so each flag appears to flutter at a different phase. (5) Set overflow: hidden on the outermost container div so no horizontal scrollbar is ever visible. (6) Use a strip background color of #0D1526 with a subtle 1px solid gold (#C9A84C at low opacity) top and bottom border to visually separate it from adjacent sections. All 14 country names must display correctly on Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge on desktop, laptop, and mobile with zero square/tofu characters.

Define the four country objects as a JavaScript array where each object has an 'emoji' string (the flag emoji character) and a 'name' string that is a fully explicit, hard-coded plain string literal â€” 'United States', 'United Kingdom', 'Canada', 'Australia' â€” with zero reliance on Unicode abbreviations or character codes. Render each flag emoji inside a dedicated <span> element with an explicit inline style setting font-family to 'Apple Color Emoji, Segoe UI Emoji, Noto Color Emoji, Android Emoji, EmojiSymbols, sans-serif' to force proper emoji font fallback on all browsers. Rewrite StrategyCallSection.tsx to replace the current two-column layout with a new single-row layout containing three side-by-side boxes: Box 1 â€” 'Schedule Your Call' containing the existing Calendly placeholder (bordered box with 'Calendly scheduling widget will appear here' text, styled to match the dark theme), the 'Schedule Call Now' gold CTA button (href: 'https://calendly.com/your-link'), and the WhatsApp 'Chat on WhatsApp' green button (href: 'https://wa.me/918766936874'); Box 2 â€” 'Send a Message' containing the existing contact form with Name, Email, and Amazon Store URL fields plus a 'Send Message' submit button with the existing submission success state; Box 3 â€” '7 Profit Killers in Amazon PPC' containing the full content currently in LeadMagnetSection: the description text 'Discover the 7 most common mistakes that drain Amazon PPC budgets â€” and how to fix them. Download your free guide now.', the email input field, the gold 'Get Free PDF' CTA button, and the existing success message state on submit. All three boxes must use glassmorphism card styling with gold border accents, consistent with the existing design system. On mobile, the three boxes must stack vertically. The section heading 'Book Your Free 30-Minute Amazon Growth Strategy Call' and supporting text must remain at the top of the section.
